CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Book Flight stage positioned above or below the Search Travel Packages stage?
SRP.A: The Book Flight stage is positioned {below} the Search Travel Packages stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Check-in at Hotel?
VE.A: The value of stage Check-in at Hotel is {340}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Select Accommodation?
VE.A: The value of stage Select Accommodation is {910}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Make Reservation?
VE.A: The value of stage Make Reservation is {639}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Search Travel Packages, with a value of {1063}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Leave Review, with a value of {213}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Select Accommodation to stage Book Flight?
SC.A: Decreased by {137} Thousand Tourists from stage Select Accommodation to stage Book Flight.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Make Reservation to stage Travel to Destination?
SC.A: Decreased by {140} Thousand Tourists from stage Make Reservation to stage Travel to Destination.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Book Flight to stage Make Reservation?
SC.A: Decreased by {134} Thousand Tourists from stage Book Flight to stage Make Reservation.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 706? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Search Travel Packages} stage has {1063}, the {Select Accommodation} stage has {910}, the {Book Flight} stage has {773}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 276? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 419 and 706? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Make Reservation} stage has {639}, the {Travel to Destination} stage has {499}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Check-in at Hotel to Leave Review, or from stage Travel to Destination to Check-in at Hotel?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Travel to Destination} to {Check-in at Hotel} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Check-in at Hotel to Leave Review, from stage Travel to Destination to Check-in at Hotel, or from stage Search Travel Packages to Select Accommodation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Travel to Destination} to stage {Check-in at Hotel} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Make Reservation to Travel to Destination, from stage Select Accommodation to Book Flight, or from stage Book Flight to Make Reservation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Make Reservation} to stage {Travel to Destination} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Travel to Destination} and {Check-in at Hotel} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Check-in at Hotel} and {Leave Review} stages.
